title: Relates to the imposition of penalties by the state ethics commission
summary: Relates to the imposition of penalties by the state ethics commission; provides for the civil penalty amount to not exceed ten thousand dollars and an amount equal to the disgorgement of any gift, compensation or benefit received in connection with the violation.

       AN ACT to amend the public  officers  law  and  the  executive  law,  in
         relation to the imposition of penalties by the state ethics commission

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 18 of section 73 of the public officers law, as
    2  amended by chapter 14 of the  laws  of  2007,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    18.  In  addition  to  any penalty contained in any other provision of
    5  law, any person who knowingly and intentionally violates the  provisions
    6  of  subdivisions  two  through  five,  seven,  eight, twelve or fourteen
    7  through seventeen of this section shall be subject to a civil penalty in
    8  an amount not to exceed forty thousand dollars and [the value] AN AMOUNT
    9  EQUAL TO DISGORGEMENT of any gift, compensation or benefit  received  in
   10  connection with such violation.  Assessment of a civil penalty hereunder
   11  shall  be  made  by the state oversight body with jurisdiction over such
   12  person. A state oversight body acting pursuant to its jurisdiction, may,
   13  in lieu of a civil penalty, with respect to a violation of  subdivisions
   14  two  through  five, seven or eight of this section, refer a violation of
   15  any such  subdivision  to  the  appropriate  prosecutor  and  upon  such
   16  conviction such violation shall be punishable as a class A misdemeanor.
   17    S  2. Subdivision 13 of section 94 of the executive law, as amended by
   18  chapter 14 of the laws of 2007, is amended to read as follows:
   19    13. An individual subject to the jurisdiction of  the  commission  who
   20  knowingly  and intentionally violates the provisions of subdivisions two
   21  through five, seven, eight, twelve  or  fourteen  through  seventeen  of
   22  section  seventy-three  of  the public officers law, section one hundred
   23  seven of the civil service law, or a reporting individual who  knowingly
   24  and  wilfully  fails to file an annual statement of financial disclosure
   25  or who knowingly and wilfully with  intent  to  deceive  makes  a  false

    1  statement  or  fraudulent omission or gives information which such indi-
    2  vidual knows to be false on such statement of financial disclosure filed
    3  pursuant to section seventy-three-a of the public officers law shall  be
    4  subject  to  a  civil  penalty in an amount not to exceed forty thousand
    5  dollars and [the value] AN AMOUNT EQUAL TO  DISGORGEMENT  of  any  gift,
    6  compensation or benefit received as a result of such violation. An indi-
    7  vidual  who knowingly and intentionally violates the provisions of para-
    8  graph b, c, d or i of subdivision three of section seventy-four  of  the
    9  public officers law shall be subject to a civil penalty in an amount not
   10  to  exceed  ten thousand dollars and the value of any gift, compensation
   11  or benefit received as a result of such  violation.  An  individual  who
   12  knowingly and intentionally violates the provisions of paragraph a, e or
   13  g  of  subdivision  three of section seventy-four of the public officers
   14  law shall be subject to a civil penalty in an amount not to  exceed  the
   15  value  of any gift, compensation or benefit received as a result of such
   16  violation. An individual subject to the jurisdiction of  the  commission
   17  who  knowingly  and  willfully violates article one-A of the legislative
   18  law shall be subject to civil penalty as provided for in  that  article.
   19  Assessment  of a civil penalty hereunder shall be made by the commission
   20  with respect to persons subject to its jurisdiction.  In  assessing  the
   21  amount  of  the  civil  penalties  to  be  imposed, the commission shall
   22  consider the seriousness of the violation, the amount  of  gain  to  the
   23  individual and whether the individual previously had any civil or crimi-
   24  nal  penalties  imposed  pursuant to this section, and any other factors
   25  the commission deems appropriate. For a violation of  this  subdivision,
   26  other  than  for  conduct  which  constitutes a violation of section one
   27  hundred seven of the civil service law, subdivisions twelve or  fourteen
   28  through  seventeen  of  section seventy-three or section seventy-four of
   29  the public officers law or article one-A of  the  legislative  law,  the
   30  commission  may,  in  lieu  of a civil penalty, refer a violation to the
   31  appropriate prosecutor and upon such conviction, such violation shall be
   32  punishable as a class A misdemeanor. A civil penalty  for  false  filing
   33  may  not  be  imposed  hereunder  in  the event a category of "value" or
   34  "amount" reported hereunder is incorrect unless such  reported  informa-
   35  tion  is falsely understated. Notwithstanding any other provision of law
   36  to the contrary, no other penalty, civil or criminal may be imposed  for
   37  a  failure  to  file,  or  for  a  false filing, of such statement, or a
   38  violation of section seventy-three of the public  officers  law,  except
   39  that  the  appointing authority may impose disciplinary action as other-
   40  wise provided by law. The commission may refer violations of this subdi-
   41  vision to the appointing authority for disciplinary action as  otherwise
   42  provided  by  law. The commission shall be deemed to be an agency within
   43  the meaning of article three of the state administrative  procedure  act
   44  and  shall adopt rules governing the conduct of adjudicatory proceedings
   45  and appeals taken pursuant  to  a  proceeding  commenced  under  article
   46  seventy-eight  of  the  civil  practice  law  and  rules relating to the
   47  assessment of the  civil  penalties  herein  authorized  and  commission
   48  denials  of requests for certain deletions or exemptions to be made from
   49  a financial disclosure statement as authorized in paragraph (h) or para-
   50  graph (i) of subdivision nine of this section. Such rules,  which  shall
   51  not  be subject to the approval requirements of the state administrative
   52  procedure act, shall  provide  for  due  process  procedural  mechanisms
   53  substantially  similar  to those set forth in article three of the state
   54  administrative procedure act but such mechanisms need not  be  identical
   55  in terms or scope. Assessment of a civil penalty or commission denial of
   56  such  a  request  shall  be  final unless modified, suspended or vacated

    1  within thirty days of imposition, with respect to the assessment of such
    2  penalty, or unless such denial of request is reversed within  such  time
    3  period,  and  upon  becoming  final  shall  be  subject to review at the
    4  instance of the affected reporting individuals in a proceeding commenced
    5  against  the  commission, pursuant to article seventy-eight of the civil
    6  practice law and rules.
    7    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
